commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Wouldn't you relish the chance to try my pickles? I'm fond of that font, it's just my type! What did the house... No, the fancy house, wear? Address.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Hello, Ai!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Sorry we're late.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Kanan, Mari! No problem. I was passing the time practicing puns! Besides, you're actually right on time.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Practicing puns?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I don't let a second go to waste! I have to practice so I'm always ready with a pun. What do you call a sad dog who likes fruit? A melon collie!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Oh, puns! Aren't they great? I've got a few myself. What's a thief's favorite metal? Steel! Turn right at every corner? You're all right!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: I get "all right," but why "steel?"

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Steal and "steel" are spelled differently, but they sound the same. They're homonyms!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Grammar puns, huh? Those are pretty hard since you need to know a lot of rules in addition to having a big vocabulary.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Right. Well, let's leave the pun talk for later. You've got a job to do today, Ai.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Oh, yeah. Today, I'll be taking you on a tour through one of Tokyo's old Shitamachi districts! We're going to have a blast!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: The old city is all about the streetscapes! The bustling markets, the charming residents, and the strange feeling that you've been here before, even if you haven't!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: It's definitely lively, isn't it? But in a different way from places with train stations and skyscrapers.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: It's almost as if time passes at a more leisurely pace here, especially compared to the busy atmosphere of the city center. Like you said, Ai, it's a strange feeling.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: So, this is the magic of old Tokyo! My Japanese heart is positively quivering with nostalgia!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I'm glad you're digging it so far!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: You can find Shitamachi districts like these all over Tokyo, each with its own famous buildings and tourist attractions.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Personally, I don't just go to see the well-known sights and buildings. I love watching the people go about their daily lives!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: I think I get what you're saying. This place has a gentle feel to it.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: It really does. Well, I'm sold! Old Tokyo all the way for me!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Already?! We just got here!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: By the way, you said Tokyo has districts like this all over. Does that mean the word for old town, "Shitamachi," doesn't only refer to this one place?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Nope. "Shitamachi" literally means "low town." Historically, it referred to towns at a low altitude, but it also meant an area where craftsmen and merchants lived.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: So it's always referred to these kinds of lively, folksy towns. I think the atmosphere here suits me perfectly. I don't feel out of place even as a tourist.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Oh, ho, ho? You're digging it too, Kanan? Wanna live here? Wanna be an old-town girl?

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: I didn't say that.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Aww, come on! Play along!
U-Umm, excuse me.

commands.speaker: Ai, Kanan, Mari
commands.line: Hmm? Huh? What?
